unnormalised: **Automotive News: A Flock of New Vehicle Launches Aims to Drive the Indian Market**
normalised: Automotive News: A Flock of New Vehicle Launches Aims to Drive the Indian Market

unnormalised: New Delhi: The Indian automotive sector is witnessing a flurry of activity, with multiple manufacturers launching new vehicles across various segments. Dr. Arun Mehta, a leading automotive analyst at IIT-Delhi, noted that this surge is driven by pent-up demand and evolving consumer preferences.
normalised: New Delhi: The Indian automotive sector is witnessing a flurry of activity, with multiple manufacturers launching new vehicles across various segments. Doctor Arun Mehta, a leading automotive analyst at I I T-Delhi, noted that this surge is driven by pent-up demand and evolving consumer preferences.

unnormalised: Maruti Suzuki recently unveiled its updated WagonR, boasting increased fuel efficiency and a revamped interior. Mahindra & Mahindra launched a new electric SUV, the XUVe8, aiming to capitalize on the growing EV market. Priced competitively, starting at Rs. 15 Lakhs, the XUVe8 promises a range of over 450 km on a single charge.
normalised: Maruti Suzuki recently unveiled its updated Wagon R, boasting increased fuel efficiency and a revamped interior. Mahindra and Mahindra launched a new electric S U V, the X U V e eight, aiming to capitalize on the growing E V market. Priced competitively, starting at rupee fifteen lakhs, the X U V e eight promises a range of over four hundred and fifty kilometer on a single charge.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Tata Motors expanded its CNG portfolio with the Tiago CNG AMT, making CNG vehicles more accessible. These launches are expected to further intensify competition, offering Indian consumers a wider array of choices. Industry experts predict that the next quarter will see even more action, including launches focused on ADAS technology and connected car features. Automakers are also expanding their manufacturing footprint, with several companies announcing new plants and expansions, like the proposed 200,000 sq ft expansion of a factory in Tamil Nadu.
normalised: Meanwhile, Tata Motors expanded its C N G portfolio with the Tiago C N G A M T, making C N G vehicles more accessible. These launches are expected to further intensify competition, offering Indian consumers a wider array of choices. Industry experts predict that the next quarter will see even more action, including launches focused on A D A S technology and connected car features. Automakers are also expanding their manufacturing footprint, with several companies announcing new plants and expansions, like the proposed two hundred thousand square feet expansion of a factory in Tamil Nadu.
